de.mslab.core

Class ByteArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mslab.core.ByteArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ByteArray
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Represents an abstraction of a byte array as used in many parts of this framework.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteArray()
      Creates a new byte array.
      ByteArray(byte[] input) 
      ByteArray(int length)
      Creates a new byte array and initializes it with length zeroes.
      ByteArray(int[] values)
      Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with values, where each value in the given array is treated as a byte, i.e., only its least-significant eight bits are used.
      ByteArray(int[] values, int position)
      Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with a given array, where each value is treated as a byte.
      ByteArray(int value, int numBytes)
      Creates a new byte array and initializes it with n bytes which represent the first n bits of the bit representation of the given value.
      ByteArray(long[] words)
      Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with a given array, where each long value is treated as a sequence of eight bytes.
      ByteArray(long[][] wordArrays)
      Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with a given array, where each long value is treated as a sequence of eight bytes.
      ByteArray(long value, int numBytes)
      Creates a new byte array and initializes it with n bytes which represent the first n bits of the bit representation of the given value.
      ByteArray(short[] values)
      Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with values, where each value in the given array is treated as a byte.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray()
        Creates a new byte array.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(short[] values)
        Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with values, where each value in the given array is treated as a byte.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(int[] values)
        Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with values, where each value in the given array is treated as a byte, i.e., only its least-significant eight bits are used.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(int[] values,
         int position)
        Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with a given array, where each value is treated as a byte. The given values are placed in positions position.. position + delta.length; the first position bytes are filled up with zeroes.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(int length)
        Creates a new byte array and initializes it with length zeroes.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(int value,
         int numBytes)
        Creates a new byte array and initializes it with n bytes which represent the first n bits of the bit representation of the given value.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(long value,
         int numBytes)
        Creates a new byte array and initializes it with n bytes which represent the first n bits of the bit representation of the given value.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(long[] words)
        Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with a given array, where each long value is treated as a sequence of eight bytes.

      • ByteArray

        public ByteArray(long[][] wordArrays)
        Creates a new byte array, and initializes it with a given array, where each long value is treated as a sequence of eight bytes.

      • and

        public ByteArray and(ByteArray other)
        Applies the logical AND operation to every i-th byte of the calling ByteArray and every i-th byte of the given ByteArray. Modifies the object.
        Parameters:
        other - The second parameter of the AND operation.

        public ByteArray clone()
        Creates a deep copy of the current ByteArray.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • concat

        public void concat(ByteArray other)
        Appends the byte of the given other byte array to this byte array. Modifies the current byte array; the other byte array is not modified.

      • copyByte

        public void copyByte(ByteArray source,
            int sourceIndex,
            int destinationIndex)
        Copies the byte value from position sourceIndex in the given byte array source at the position destinationIndex in the current byte array. Modifies the current byte array; the other byte array is not modified.

      • copyBytes

        public void copyBytes(ByteArray source)
        Calls copyBytes(ByteArray, int, int, int) with arguments source, 0, 0, source.length().

             int sourceFrom)
        Calls copyBytes(ByteArray, int, int, int) with arguments source, sourceFrom, 0, source.length().

      • copyBytes

        public void copyBytes(ByteArray source,
             int sourceFrom,
             int destinationIndex)
        Calls copyBytes(ByteArray, int, int, int) with arguments source, sourceFrom, destinationIndex, source.length().

      • copyBytes

        public void copyBytes(ByteArray source,
             int sourceFrom,
             int destinationIndex,
             int numBytes)
        Copies a sequence of numBytes bytes from position sourceFrom in the given byte array source, to starting from the position destinationIndex in the current byte array. Modifies the current byte array; the other byte array is not modified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If sourceFrom or destinationIndex are less than zero, or if the length of the source array or the current array is not great enough.

      • countNumActiveBits

        public int countNumActiveBits()
        Counts and returns the number of non-zero bits in the byte array.

      • countNumActiveBytes

        public int countNumActiveBytes()
        Counts and returns the number of non-zero bytes in the byte array.

      • countNumActiveNibbles

        public int countNumActiveNibbles()
        Counts and returns the number of non-zero nibbles (half-bytes) in the byte array.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(int value)
        Tests if all bytes in the byte array are equal to the given value. Returns true if all bytes are equal to value, returns false otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(int[] other)
        Returns true, if the value at any position i in the byte array is equal to the value at any position i in the given array, and if the length of the byte array and the given other array are equal. Returns false otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(ByteArray other)
        Returns true, if the value at any position i in the byte array is equal to the value at any position i in the given byte array, and if the length of the byte array and the given other byte array are equal. Returns false otherwise.

        public short get(int position)
        Returns the byte value at the given position.

      • getArray

        public short[] getArray()

      • getArray

        public short[] getArray(int from,
               int to)
        Returns a copy of the internal array's values from position from to position to. In the result, the values are located from position 0 to position to - from - 1.

      • getBit

        public boolean getBit(int position)
        Treats the byte array as a sequence of bits. Returns the bit value at position % 8 from the byte at position / 8.

      • getDifference

        public ByteArray getDifference(ByteArray other)
        Returns the byte-wise XOR difference of this byte array and the given other byte array.
        Returns:
        Returns a copy, does not modify the current byte array, does not modify the other byte array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - If the lengths are not equal.

      • getNibble

        public int getNibble(int position)

      • isFullyActive

        public boolean isFullyActive()
        Tests if all bytes in the byte array are not equal to zero.
        Returns:
        Returns true, if there is no byte equal to zero in the current byte array; false otherwise.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of the current byte array.

      • or

        public ByteArray or(ByteArray other)
        Applies the logical OR between every i-th byte of the current ByteArray and every i-th byte of the other array. Modifies the current ByteArray.
        Parameters:
        other -

      • or

        public ByteArray or(ByteArray other,
           int from,
           int to)

      • randomize

        public void randomize()
        Sets every byte in the current ByteArray to a random value between [0 ... 255].

      • readLong

        public long readLong(int position)
        Creates a 64-bit long value from eight bytes of the current ByteArray, starting at the given position in the ByteArray. For instance, if the position is 5, and the length of the ByteArray is 20, the returned long contains the bytes from positions 5 || 6 || 7 || 8 || 9 || 10 || 11 || 12, where the byte at position 5 is used as the most significant eight bits of the return value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the length of the ByteArray is less or equal to position + 8.

      • readLongs

        public long[] readLongs()
        Calls readLongs(int) position set to 0.

      • readLongs

        public long[] readLongs(int position)
        Reads all bytes from the given position until the end of the ByteArray.

      • splice

        public ByteArray splice(int from)
        Calls splice(int,int) with the second parameter set to the length of the current array.

      • splice

        public ByteArray splice(int from,
               int to)
        Returns a deep copy which copies the elements of the current byte array from index from to index to, including from, and excluding to. In the result, these values are placed in the range of 0 .. (to - from - 1).

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int position,
              short[] newBytes)
        Writes the given bytes in the current byte array in the given order, starting from the given position in the current byte array. If the capacity of the current byte array can not take all bytes, then its capacity is automatically extended.
